doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF AIR AMBULANCE SERVICE

TWO OF THE DEFINING CHARACTERISTICS OF ACTIVE GALACTIC NUCLEI (AGN) ARE THE BROAD SPECTRAL RANGE SPANNED BY THEIR EMISSION AND THEIR VARIABILITY. HOWEVER, THERE IS A TENSION BETWEEN THESE TRAITS. WE NEED OBSERVATIONAL DATA FROM A BROAD SPECTRAL RANGE TO MAKE A COMPLETE PICTURE OF AGN, BUT IT IS OFTEN IMPRACTICAL OR IMPOSSIBLE TO COLLECT ALL THESE DATA AT THE SAME TIME. WHEN WE DO NOT, VARIABILITY BETWEEN OBSERVATIONS CAN MISLEAD US, CAUSING US TO MISINTERPRET THE SHAPE OF THE SPECTRUM. AS A RESULT, IF WE LOOK FOR CORRELATIONS BETWEEN THE SPECTRAL SHAPE AND OTHER PARAMETERS, OUR DATA WILL HAVE EXTRA INDUCED NOISE THAT CAN DILUTE OR HIDE THE TRENDS WE ARE LOOKING FOR. THIS PROBLEM IS ESPECIALLY VEXING IN THE UV AND X-RAY BANDS, AS THESE EXHIBIT STRONGER AND MORE RAPID VARIABILITY THAN FOUND AT LONGER WAVELENGTHS. OUR SOLUTION IS TO EXPLOIT DATA IN THE SWIFT ARCHIVE. SWIFT'S COMBINATION OF SIMULTANEOUS OPTICAL-UV AND X-RAY DATA COLLECTION, WIDE FIELD-OF-VIEW IMAGERS AND MANY FIELDS WITH REPEATED OBSERVATIONS MEANS THAT THE ARCHIVE INCLUDES THOUSANDS OF AGN THAT HAVE BEEN SERENDIPITOUSLY OBSERVED MULTIPLE TIMES, WITH SIMULTANEOUS DATA TAKEN IN THE BANDS THAT VARY MOST. HUNDREDS OF THESE WILL HAVE ENOUGH INTENSIVE MONITORING DATA TO PROVIDE DETAILED LIGHT CURVES. WITH THESE DATA, WE CAN SEPARATE THE INDUCED NOISE OF NON-SIMULTANEOUS OBSERVATIONS OF VARIABLE SOURCES FROM INTRINSIC SCATTER IN THE CORRELATIONS. WE WILL CHARACTERIZE THE VARIABILITY IN EACH OBSERVED BAND, THEREBY PUTTING STRONG CONSTRAINTS ON THE SIZE OF THE EMITTING REGIONS. WE WILL MEASURE THE DEGREE OF VARIABILITY IN THE SPECTRAL SHAPE THAT IS INTRINSIC TO THE AGN AND QUANTIFY THE INDUCED NOISE. WITH A SAMPLE THAT IS SEVERAL TIMES LARGER THAN PAST STUDIES AND LACKING THE INDUCED NOISE, WE WILL TEST WHETHER WE CAN IMPROVE UPON THE PREVIOUSLY-REPORTED CORRELATIONS AND LOOK FOR NEW ONES IN A WIDER RANGE OF PARAMETER SPACE, INCLUDING INTRINSIC PARAMETERS SUCH AS BLACK HOLE MASS, BOLOMETRIC LUMINOSITY, AND EDDINGTON ACCRETION RATE. ONE OF OUR DATA PRODUCTS WILL BE A CATALOG OF THE MULTIWAVELENGTH PROPERTIES AND VARIABILITY CHARACTERISTICS OF THOUSANDS OF AGN. THIS WILL BE AN IMPORTANT LEGACY OF SWIFT. WE ANTICIPATE FINDING 20-40 AGN WITH SUFFICIENT DATA QUALITY TO PERFORM A DISCRETE CORRELATION FUNCTION ANALYSIS TO TEST FOR CORRELATED VARIABILITY BETWEEN THE X-RAY AND THE OPTICAL-UV BANDS. STUDIES OF SUCH CORRELATIONS HAVE YIELDED IMPORTANT INFORMATION ABOUT THE GEOMETRIES AND PROCESSES OF THE EMITTING REGIONS, BUT HAVE BEEN LIMITED TO A SMALL NUMBER OF AGN DUE TO THE RESOURCES REQUIRED TO MOUNT COORDINATED MULTIWAVELENGTH OBSERVATIONS. THE SWIFT ARCHIVE SHOULD PROVIDE A SUBSTANTIALLY LARGER SAMPLE, ONE THAT IS FREE OF MANY BIASES BECAUSE THE SOURCES ARE SERENDIPITOUS, ALLOWING US TO DRAW MORE GENERAL CONCLUSIONS. WITH THE REST OF THE AGN, MANY WITH ONLY A FEW OBSERVATIONS EACH, WE WILL DEFINE A STRUCTURE FUNCTION TO MEASURE THE ENSEMBLE VARIABILITY CHARACTERISTICS ON A RANGE OF TIMESCALES FROM DAYS TO YEARS. THROUGH A COMBINATION OF DETAILED TIMING ANALYSIS OF A SMALL SAMPLE AND A STATISTICAL ANALYSIS OF A MUCH LARGER SAMPLE, WE WILL TAKE TWO INDEPENDENT APPROACHES TO USING MULTIWAVELENGTH VARIABILITY TO REFINE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE STRUCTURES WITHIN AGN. WE WILL TEST THE GEOMETRY AND THE EMISSION MECHANISMS OF THE ACCRETION DISK, THE NEARBY COMPTON SCATTERING REGION, AND POSSIBLY MORE DISTANT REPROCESSING REGIONS. IN THE PROCESS, WE WILL GAIN NEW INSIGHTS INTO AGN AND THE SURROUNDING STRUCTURES THAT PROVIDE THE FEEDBACK LINK BETWEEN THEM AND THEIR HOST GALAXIES.
doc.MajorAgency: THE SWIFT VIEW OF AGN: INSIGHTS FROM MULTIWAVELENG
doc.MajorFundingAgency: THE SWIFT VIEW OF AGN: INSIGHTS FROM MULTIWAVELENG

doc.ContractDescription: PROJECT SUMMARY MANIFESTATIONS OF OCEANIC MESOSCALE, SUBMESOSCALE, AND INTERNAL-WAVE VARIABILITY IN SWOT DATA THIS IS A PROPOSAL TO PARTICIPATE IN SWOT SCIENCE DEFINITION TEAM (SDT) ACTIVITIES. OUR INTERESTS ARE IN ASSESSING HOW VARIOUS OCEANOGRAPHIC PHENOMENA (OCEANIC MESOSCALES, SUBMESOSCALES, AND INTERNAL WAVES) MAY BE MANIFEST IN SWOT MEASUREMENTS AND IN HELPING TO ADDRESS THE ASSOCIATED CHALLENGES POSED TO MISSION PLANNING AND DEFINITION OF REQUIREMENTS. THESE INTERESTS ARE CLOSELY TIED TO OUR RESEARCH INTERESTS AND OUR EXPERIENCE IN EXTRACTING INFORMATION ABOUT OCEAN DYNAMICS USING DATA FROM PREVIOUS SATELLITE ALTIMETRY MISSIONS AND OTHER SATELLITE OBSERVATIONS. SPECIFICALLY, OUR WORK WILL INCLUDE: (1) USE OF EXISTING THEORY AND DATA TO BETTER ASSESS THE EXPECTED EXPRESSION OF INTERNAL WAVES IN SWOT DATA AND THE POSSIBILITY THAT THESE WAVES MIGHT COMPLICATE OBSERVATIONS OF NEARLY GEOSTROPHIC, SUBMESOSCALE VARIABILITY, (2) EVALUATION OF THE PRACTICAL VALUE OF SURFACE QUASI-GEOSTROPHIC (SQG) THEORY, EXTENDED-SQG (ESQG) THEORY, AND OTHER DYNAMICAL-BALANCE ASSUMPTIONS FOR INTERPRETATION OF SWOT DATA, AND (3) EXAMINATION OF HOW SWOT COULD BE USED TO IMPROVE UNDERSTANDING OF OCEANIC MESOSCALE EDDIES. CONSIDERATION OF THE IMPLICATIONS OF RESULTS FROM THESE STUDIES FOR SWOT MISSION REQUIREMENTS, AND COLLABORATION WITH OTHER MEMBERS OF THE SDT TOWARD SUCCESS OF THE SWOT SDT ACTIVITIES, WILL BE INTEGRAL TO OUR PROPOSED EFFORT.

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF MOBIS SCHEDULE IS NO LONGER ACTIVE IT HAS BEEN CONSOLIDATED TO PSS. THE NEW NUMBER IS GS00F252CA UNDER SIN C874-1. ADDITIONALLY, THIS MOD IS CHANGING THE CONTRACT TYPE FROM A FIXED PRICE TO TIME AND MATERIALS CONTRACT.

THE SHALLOW POTENTIALS OF GALAXY GROUPS MAKE THEM VULNERABLE TO HEATING AND GAS LOSS CAUSED BY POWERFUL AGN OUTBURSTS. THEORETICAL MODELS SUGGEST THAT FEEDBACK AT Z 2 MUST HAVE EJECTED GAS FROM GROUPS, REDUCING THEIR BARYON CONTENT, BUT A LACK OF IDENTIFIED NEARBY NON COOL CORE (NCC) GROUPS MAKES IT DIFFICULT TO DETERMINE WHETHER AGN CONTINUE TO HAVE SUCH A SIGNIFICANT IMPACT ON THE STRUCTURE OF THE INTRA GROUP MEDIUM (IGM).WE PROPOSE A DEEP OBSERVATION OF HCG 15, A DISTURBED NON-COOL-CORE GROUP WHICH APPEARS TO HAVE UNDERGONE AN EXCEPTIONALLY POWERFUL AGN OUTBURST 190-330 MYR AGO. WE WILL SEARCH FOR CAVITIES, MAKE A MORE ACCURATE ESTIMATE OF THE OUTBURST POWER, EXAMINE THE IGM FOR EVIDENCE OF OUTWARD GAS TRANSPORT, AND DETERMINE WHETHER THE AGN HAS DISRUPTED THE GROUP CORE.
